・彼女はその男に心を引かれた.　Her heart warmed to [She found herself greatly attracted to] the man.
・彼の心をつなぎとめておきたい.　I want to keep him interested (in me).
・心をそらす　be distracted 《by…》

►彼の心は読めない.　You can't tell what he's thinking.
・離れていても心は一つだ.　Though divided ┏we [our feelings, our thoughts] are one.
・心は燃えても, 肉体は弱い.　【聖】 The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak.
・心内に動けば詞(ことば)外に現る.　When the heart moves, words emerge.

►被害者の心を汲んで判決を厳しくする　bear the wishes of the victim in mind and make the punishment strict.
►あなたの心次第です.　It's up to you. ｜ The decision is yours.

・(写真の色が現像液の中で)だんだん濃くなってくる.　The picture is gradually coming ┏out [through].
・山の緑が濃くなってきた.　The green of the mountains has deepened in color. ｜ The mountains have become a deeper green.
・霧が濃くなってきた.　The ┏mist [fog] is getting thick(er). ｜ There's an increasingly dense fog. ｜ It's getting very ┏misty [foggy].
・煮詰まって味が濃くなった.　With boiling down, the flavor has got stronger. ｜ Long boiling has given 《the stock》 a ┏deeper [strong(er), more concentrated] flavor.
・彼女の優勝の可能性が濃くなってきた.　It is increasingly ┏probable [possible] that she'll win. ｜ Her chances of victory have strengthened.
・日本チームの敗色が濃くなってきた.　It seems increasingly likely that the Japanese team will be defeated. ｜ The chances of Japan winning are increasingly remote.
・息子のひげがだいぶ濃くなってきた.　My son's chin has ┏darkened considerably [grown quite hairy]. ｜ There's now quite a lot of hair on my son's face.

こきゅう１【呼吸】 [ローマ字](kokyū)
1 〔息〕 breathing; (呼吸作用) respiration; (1 回) a breath.
〜する breathe; respire; inhale and exhale.
►鼻[口]で呼吸する　breathe through ┏the [one's] nose [mouth]
・新鮮な空気を呼吸する　breathe fresh air; get a breath of fresh air
・人は 1 分間に 18 回呼吸する.　A person ┏breathes [respires] eighteen times a minute. ｜ Human beings take eighteen breaths a minute.
►患者は呼吸が乱れはじめた.　The patient's ┏breathing [respiration] became irregular.
・高熱のため呼吸が荒い.　He's ┏breathing heavily [having difficulty (in) breathing] because of his high temperature.
・呼吸が促迫する　〈人が主語〉 pant; gasp; get short of breath
・呼吸が絶える　respiration ┏stops [ceases]; 〈人が主語〉 stop [cease] breathing; 〔死ぬ〕 die; 《文》 expire; breathe one's last
・患者は一時呼吸が止まった.　The patient stopped breathing for a moment. ｜ There was a temporary cessation in the patient's respiration.
・呼吸が停止している.　He ┏has stopped breathing [isn't breathing]. ｜ His respiration has ceased.
・呼吸が苦しい.　I can't breathe. ｜ It's hard to breathe. ｜ I find breathing painful.
・前より呼吸が楽になった.　It's getting easier to breathe. ｜ I'm getting my breath back.
・呼吸が穏やかになった.　Her breathing has steadied (down). ｜ She's breathing more regularly.
・呼吸がだんだん弱く不規則になってきた.　His breathing gradually became weaker and more irregular.
►患者の呼吸を数える　count how many breaths a patient takes; check a patient's respiratory rate
・深く呼吸をする　take [draw] a deep breath; 〔吸う〕 breathe in [inhale] deeply; 〔吐く〕 breathe out [exhale] deeply
・呼吸を整える　get one's breathing under control; catch one's breath.
►呼吸は普通です(問題ありません).　Your ┏breathing [respiration] is normal. ｜ There's nothing wrong with your breathing.
・体温 37 度, 呼吸16, 脈拍 80 であった.　Body temperature was 37 degrees, respiratory rate 16 and pulse 80.
2 〔互いの気持ち〕
►阿吽(あうん)の呼吸　⇒あうん.
►全選手の呼吸がぴったり合った.　There was perfect ┏teamwork [coordination] (between all the players). ｜ The team moved as one.
・〔アイスダンスで〕 パートナーと呼吸が合わずリンク中央で転倒した.　I was out of sync with my partner and fell down in the middle of the rink.
・その漫才はまるで 10 年コンビをやってきたみたいに呼吸が合っていた.　Their routine was so tightly coordinated it seemed as though they'd been performing together for ten years.
・〔相撲で〕 両力士なかなか呼吸が合わず, 3 度目の仕切り直しです.　The wrestlers can't seem to synchronize their breathing and they're toeing their marks for the third time.
►全員が呼吸を合わせないとこの仕事は無理だ.　We can't do this job unless ┏we move together [each of us knows what the others are doing].
・相手の呼吸をはかる　try to see what the other person ┏is thinking [wants]; try to guess what's on one's partner's mind.
►さすが双子のバッテリー, 呼吸はぴったりだ.　Just as you might expect, the pitcher-catcher twins work together perfectly.
3 〔要領・こつ〕 the knack 《of…》; the secret 《of…》; the trick 《of…》; know-how; how to do; 〔タイミングの取り方〕 timing.
►窯(かま)の火をいつ落とすか, その呼吸が飲み込めないと一人前ではない.　You can't say you are a true potter until ┏you've mastered the trick of knowing when to lower the temperature of the kiln [you can time the lowering of kiln temperature properly].
・そこの呼吸がちょっと難しい.　It's a bit difficult to get the knack of that. ｜ 《口》 That's a rather fiddly ┏bit [job].
・押すか引くか, 商売ではその呼吸が微妙なんだ.　It's a delicate matter deciding whether to push a sale or to let the customer take the initiative.
►その呼吸で行け.　You're ┏going about it the right way [on the right track]. ｜ That's the ┏way [spirit, idea].
►呼吸を覚える[のみ込む]　get the ┏knack [hang] 《of…》; get the feel 《of…》; learn the trick 《of…》; learn the ropes; learn how to 《drive a jeep》
・その新しい機械を操作する呼吸を彼女はすぐに会得した.　She mastered (the use of) the new machine in no time. ｜ She learned how to use the new machine in a flash.
・今の呼吸を忘れるな.　Don't forget how you did it. ｜ That's the way! Remember that.
・漁師たちは呼吸を合わせて網を引いた.　The fishermen pulled rhythmically on the net together. ｜ The fishermen worked rhythmically together to pull in the net.
►そのあたりの呼吸は彼女にはわかっている.　She knows what she's ┏doing [about] in that area. ｜ When it comes to that she doesn't need someone telling her what to do.
◨喘(あえ)ぎ呼吸　gasping; panting.

こまる【困る】 [ローマ字](komaru)
1 〔不便を感じる〕 be put out; be inconvenienced; be in a bad way; 《口》 be loused up.
►人手が足りなくて困る　be set back by a lack of sufficient help.
►ここにいすがないと困る.　We've got to have chairs here.
・この辺は公衆電話がなくて困る.　It's very inconvenient around here with no public phones.
・トイレが見つからなくて困った.　There was no toilet around and I didn't know what to do.
・女房がなくてもなにひとつ困らない.　I do just fine without a wife.
・突然の停電で困った.　We were discommoded by the sudden blackout.
2 〔対処に窮する〕 be embarrassed 《by [with]…》; be perplexed 《at [about, with]…》; be stumped; be [feel] at a loss; be at one's ┏wit's [wits'] end; be in a fix; *be nonplus(s)ed 《about…》; *《口》 be in a jam. [⇒こまった]
►返事[応対]に困る　be at a loss for ┏an answer [a response]
・困ったなあという顔をする　look ┏troubled [embarrassed].
►どうしたらいいかわからなくて困っている.　I just don't know what to do.
・図書館から借りた本をなくして困っている.　I lost the book I borrowed from the library and I don't know what to do.
・雨が降ると困るから傘を持ってきた.　I took an umbrella because I didn't want to get caught if it rained.
・君は生ものがだめだから困る.　It's a problem that you won't eat anything raw.
・どうしよう, 困ったな.　Now what am I going to do? Boy oh boy!
・〔贈り物や厚意に〕 こんなにしていただいては困ります.　This is really too kind. (I don't know ┏what to say [how to thank you].)
・思いがけないことになって困っている.　I never thought it would turn out this way―what a mess!
・旅行中は言葉が通じなくて困った.　Unable to communicate with anyone on the trip, I was at a loss.
・困った時には助けてやるよ.　When you run into a problem I'll help you out.
・何か困っていることはありませんか.　Is everything going along smoothly?
・困ったときの友が真の友.　A friend in need is a friend indeed. 【諺】
・彼はたばこがやめられなくて困っている.　He's very troubled because he can't stop smoking.
・道がわからなくて困った.　Not knowing the roads, I was quite at a loss which way to go.
・いま君に抜けられては困る.　We can't have you walk out on us now.
・今ちょっと困っているんだ.　I'm having some trouble just now. ｜ At the moment, I've got a problem.
・今さらそんなことを言われても困る.　Saying that at this point really puts me in a bind.
・見くびってもらっては困る.　Don't patronize me.
3 〔迷惑する〕 be annoyed 《at [about, with, by]…》; be troubled 《with mosquitoes》; be bothered 《with children》; 〔苦痛である〕 be ┏pained [aggrieved, distressed] 《by…》. [⇒こまった]
►のどが痛くて困っている　suffer from a sore throat
・靴擦れで困っている　be plagued by shoe sores.
►約束を守ってくれなくちゃ困るよ.　We can't have you going back on your promise. ｜ We would be much aggrieved if you were not to keep your promise.
・君, 困るじゃないか, こんなことをして.　I say, this will never do.
・それは困ります. やめてください.　We can't have that. Please don't.
・道路の騒音には皆がたいへん困っている.　Highway noise has become a big problem for everyone.
・お宅の犬にほえられて困りました.　Your dog's barking at me that way was most unpleasant.
4 〔不都合である〕 be inconvenienced; be embarrassed; be compromised.
►人に見られたら困る手紙　a letter not for other eyes.
►どの店にも私に合うサイズの靴がなくて困る.　I find it very inconvenient that no store carries shoes in my size.
5 〔貧窮する〕 be ┏badly [ill] off; be in want; be hard up; be destitute; be in ┏needy [straitened] circumstances.
►生活に困る　find it difficult to make a living; live in want
・金に困っている　be ┏hard up [pressed] for money; be in financial difficulty; be in straitened circumstances; be in straits; be strapped (for cash)
・一生困らないだけの金　enough money to ┏set one up [free one from financial worries] for life
・その日のものにも困っている家族　a family that has to live from hand to mouth.
►家賃を払えないとは彼もかなり困っているらしい.　If he can't pay the rent, he must be in pretty bad straits.
・こうしてまじめに働いている分には困らない.　As long as I keep working hard this way I won't have any financial worries.
・生活保護法は困っている人を助けるための法律だ.　The National Assistance Law is to help those who are in straitened circumstances.
・失業して困ったとき, 父が仕送りをしてくれた.　When I was hard up after I lost my job, my Dad ┏helped [sent money to help] me out.
・犯罪は金に困っている人たちがやるとは限らない.　The commission of crimes is not limited to people who are hard up for money.
・彼は金には困っていない.　He's got no money worries.

►考慮すべき点[事項]　points to bear in mind; things to remember; terms of reference
・利用者の便宜を十分に考慮する　be fully aware of the convenience of users; keep users' needs fully in mind
・十分考慮した上で　after ┏careful thought [due consideration]
・真剣に考慮する　give 《a matter》 (one's) serious consideration; think seriously about 《whether to do》
・その点は特に考慮したいと思う.　I think we should ┏bear that (point) particularly in mind [give special consideration to that]. ｜ That point deserves special consideration.
・…を考慮すると　in view of (the fact that)…; bearing in mind that…; given (the fact) that…
・被告人が犯行当時 未成年であった点を考慮して刑を軽減した.　Bearing in mind [In view of the fact] that the accused was a minor at the time, the court reduced the sentence.
・(応募者の)学歴は一切考慮しない.　We ignore academic background altogether. ｜ Academic background plays no part in our considerations.
・その点については十分考慮した.　We have given careful consideration to the point. ｜ This point has been considered carefully.
・これを第一に考慮しなければならない.　This is ┏the most important thing to be considered [the first consideration].
・現場での実績が何よりも考慮すべき事項である.　Actual performance in the workplace should be a more important consideration than anything else.
►深甚なる考慮　deep [careful] consideration.
►考慮中である　〈人が主語〉 have 《a matter》 under consideration; be thinking about 《a matter》; 〈事が主語〉 be under consideration.
►考慮に値する[値しない]　be [be not] worth ┏considering [bearing in mind]
・…を十分考慮に入れて　with due regard to…; bearing…fully in mind
・若さ[未熟さ]を考慮に入れる　take sb's ┏youth [inexperience] into consideration; bear sb's ┏youth [inexperience] in mind; make allowance(s) for sb's ┏youth [inexperience]
・それは考慮に入れないことにする.　I'll leave that out of ┏consideration [account]. ｜ I won't take that into account. ｜ I'll ignore that.

►まだ考慮の余地がある.　There is still some room for consideration.

・採否に関し国籍は考慮の対象にしない.　Nationality will not be taken into consideration in any employment decision. ｜ We shall ignore nationality in deciding whether or not to employ somebody.

►考慮を払う　give consideration to…; bear…in mind; consider

・腰をかがめる[折る]　bend (over [down]); bend one's back; stoop 《to pick sth up》; 〔会釈する〕 bow
・腰を掛ける　＝こしかける
・腰を伸ばす　straighten up; straighten [stretch] one's body

・腰をさする　rub one's ┏hip [lower back]
・腰をもんでもらう　have one's lower back massaged

2 〔構え・態勢〕
►腰が重い　be slow to start; get off to a slow start; be slow off the mark; be slow to act; be dilatory (in starting); 〔力士などが〕 be (very) stable; be (very) steady on one's feet
・腰が軽い　be quick to act; be quick off the mark; 〔力士などが〕 be (very) unstable; be (very) unsteady on one's feet
・腰が強い　〔強気で人に屈しない〕 be firm; be doughty; be unbending
・腰が弱い　〔弱気でねばり強さに欠ける〕 be feeble; be soft; lack firmness
・初めは威勢がよかったが, 仲間に反対されるとすぐに腰が砕けた.　He started off full of enthusiasm, but as soon as there was opposition from his colleagues ┏he lost heart [he faltered, the stuffing went out of him].
・腰が据わる　be [remain] calm (and collected); retain one's self-possession; 《口》 stay cool
・腰が引ける　get cold feet; despair; be pessimistic (of one's chances)
・リーダーの君がそんなに腰が引けていてはだれもついて行かないよ.　You're the leader! If you're so ┏defeatist [pathetic, gutless], nobody will follow you.
►ここの店主は腰の低い人だ.　The store owner is quite ┏unassuming [modest, unpretentious].
・職場を転々として一か所に腰の据わらない男だ.　He moves from job to job and won't settle down (in one place).

►腰を上げる　〔行動に出る〕 act; start; take action; get moving
・政府はようやく重い腰を上げた.　The government has at last ┏reluctantly [unwillingly, slowly] begun to take action [started moving]. ｜ The government has belatedly started doing something at last.
・腰を入れて計画の実現に取り組んでいる.　We are putting ┏everything [all our energies] into getting the project off the ground. ｜ We are doing everything we can to putting the project into effect.

►電気系統の故障　a power ┏failure [cut]; a fault in an electricity supply system; something wrong with the electrical system

・機械の故障　mechanical trouble; a mechanical failure; something wrong with a machine; a mechanical fault.

こうたい１【交代・交替】 [ローマ字](kōtai)
〔前任者との〕 a change 《of government》; a replacement; a substitute; (a) substitution; an alternative; alternation; (a) rotation; (選手の) a replacement; a substitute; 〔勤務の〕 a substitute; (見張りなどの) a relief; (工員などの交代組) a shift; a rota.
〜する 〔前任者と〕 replace 《one's boss》; take sb's place; change places 《with…》; take over 《a business, from the previous generation, as boss》; switch places 《with…》; ᐦswap places 《with…》; 〔勤務を〕 relieve 《a shift》; change 《the guard》.
►投手を交代させる　change pitchers; relieve the pitcher
・(選手を)交代させる　〔野球で〕 substitute sb for sb; relieve the pitcher; 《俗》 yank the pitcher and bring in 《a lefty》; 〔サッカー・バレーボールなどで〕 substitute sb for sb; change players
・あの会社は最近社長が交代した.　There's been a change of presidents at that company recently. ｜ The company has just got a new president.
・首相が森氏から小泉氏に交代した.　Koizumi ┏replaced [took over from] Mori as Prime Minister.
・5 回で投手が交代した.　In the fifth inning the pitcher was ┏relieved [*《俗》 sent to the showers].
・妻と交代して車を運転した.　I took over the driving from my wife. ｜ I replaced my wife at the wheel.
・当直の医者は 8 時間ごとに交代する.　The doctor on duty changes [A new doctor comes on duty] every eight hours.
・だれか交代してくれる人はいないか.　Isn't there anyone who'll ┏take over (from me) [change places with me]?
►衛兵の交代　a change of guard; 〔儀式〕 the changing of the guard.
►交代が来るまで私はここを離れられない.　I can't leave until ┏somebody comes to take over [my substitute comes].
►昼夜交代で働いている.　We ┏do [work in] night and day shifts.
・…を交代でする　take turns ┏to do [at doing]; do in turns
・二人が交代で車を運転した.　The two of them took turns ┏driving [at the wheel].
・1 日 3交代で働く　work in three shifts of eight hours (each); work on three eight-hour shifts
・(兵士が前線から)交代で帰国する　come [go, be sent] home on rotation
・交代で 1 日おきに出勤する　work [go to work] on alternate-day shifts
・社員は交代で休暇を取る.　Employees ┏take leave in rotation [go on vacation in turns].
・この工場は 8 時間交代で操業しています.　The factory operates on eight-hour shifts.
►1 時間交代にしよう.　Let's ┏change over every hour [take one-hour turns].
・2 人[3 人]で交代に　two [three] people, in turn.
◨政権交代　a change of ┏government [administration].
世代交代　a change of generation; a new generation taking over.
◧交代遺伝　【医】 alternative inheritance.
交代員　＝こうたいよういん.
交代関数　【数】 an alternant; an alternating function.
交代鉱床　【地質】 a metasomatic deposit; a replacement deposit.
交代作用　【地質】 metasomatism; replacement.
交代時間　the time when ┏sb takes over [one is relieved].
►次の交代時間まで私はここで缶詰だ.　I'm tied down here ┏until I'm relieved [the next shift comes on duty].
交代式　【数】 an alternating expression.
交代制　⇒こうたいせい２.
交替操業　【労】 (a) shift operation; working in shifts.
►(工場が)昼夜交代操業をする　operate on day and night shifts.
交替反応　【化】 〔金属錯体の〕 interchange mechanism.
交代兵　〔歩哨などの〕 a relief.
交代要員　⇒こうたいよういん.

・彼の言動にはことさら(に)目立つところはなかった.　There was nothing particularly ┏striking [noticeable] in his language or behavior. ｜ He didn't do or say anything particularly striking.

2 〔故意に〕 intentionally; knowingly; deliberately; wittingly; designedly; on purpose; purposely; 〔わざわざ〕 at the expense of extra effort.
►ことさらに大声でわめく　scream loudly on purpose.

・ことさらに問題を複雑にする必要はない.　Don't make extra work for us by adding needless complications to the problem.
・他人の家庭事情をことさらに話題にしたがるのは自分の家庭がうまく行っていない人だ.　It is people from unhappy homes who go out of their way to talk about other people's family circumstances.

1 〔事前の通告〕 notice; (a) notification; (a) warning; 〔了解〕 permission; leave; consent.

►断りの手紙　〔拒絶の〕 a letter of refusal; 〔辞退の〕 《send》 a refusal; 《send》 one's regrets; a letter of apology; a letter declining an invitation

ことわる【断る】 [ローマ字](kotowaru)
1 〔拒絶する〕 refuse 《a bribe, an office, a gift》; reject; turn down; *throw sb down; 〔辞退する〕 decline 《an invitation》; turn down; refuse; say no; excuse oneself; ask to be excused 《from attending》.
►縁談を断る　turn down [decline, refuse] an offer to be introduced to ┏somebody [a possible marriage partner]
・借金の依頼を断る　refuse [turn down] a request for a loan; refuse to lend sb money
・出席を断る　say that one cannot attend; excuse oneself from ┏attendance [attending 《a party》]
・人の入場を断る　do not let sb in; 《文》 deny sb admittance; deny admittance to sb
・申し出を断る　reject [turn down] an offer [a suggestion, a proposal]

・注文を断る　decline (to fulfill) an order; do not accept an order
・にべもなく断る　refuse flatly; decline outright; say an outright no; give [make] a curt refusal
・彼女からの依頼であれば無下に断るわけにもいかない.　(In her case) I can't just refuse her request outright. ｜ I cannot just flatly turn her down.
►忙しくて行かれないと断ってください.　Tell them that I'm too busy to go.
・会いたくないと言って断ってください.　Tell them [Say] that I don't want to see them.
・女性に頼まれると断りにくいね.　It's difficult to refuse a lady.
・どうしても断りきれなかった.　I just couldn't (bring myself to) refuse. ｜ I simply had to accept.
2 〔事前に通告する〕 give sb ┏notice [warning]; warn 《sb》; tell 《sb》 (in advance); 〔了解を得る〕 ask (for) permission; ask sb (in advance); get permission; ask sb's permission [leave].
►断らずに　〔予告せずに〕 without (previous) notice; without (advance) warning; without saying 《so》 ┏in advance [beforehand]; 〔了解なく〕 without ┏permission [leave]
・断らずに外出する　go out without (asking [getting, obtaining]) permission; 〔知らせずに〕 go out without telling 《one's parents》.
►はっきり断っておくが, これは私専用だ.　I want to [Let me] make this ┏absolutely [crystal] clear. Nobody is to use this except me. ｜ Let's be clear about this. I am the only person who can use this.
・ひとこと断っておくが….　I'd like you to remember that…. ｜ May I remind you that…? ｜ Please ┏remember [don't forget]….
・明日の予定の変更は電話で断っておいた.　I phoned to warn her about the change in tomorrow's plans.
・だれに断ってそんなことをしたのか.　Who ┏gave you permission to [said you could] do that?

・それを聞いて彼女は急に口が堅くなった.　〔黙り込んだ〕 She suddenly clammed up when she heard that.

・彼は酒が回ると口が軽くなるから, 酔わせて聞き出そう.　Intoxication loosens his tongue, so let's get him drunk and then pump him (for information).

口が曲がる
►そのキムチは口が曲がるほど辛い.　That kimchee is spicy enough to make your mouth smoke.
・君はあの人の悪口を言うと口が曲がるよ.　You're going to get in big trouble if you [You should never] say bad things about that person.
口から先に生まれる　be born mouth first; be born with the gift of gab; be a chatterbox.

口から出かかる　be ┏on [at] the tip of one's tongue.

口が悪い　be foulmouthed; have a ┏sharp [venomous, bitter, harsh] tongue; have a foul mouth.
►彼は口は悪いけどいい人だよ.　He has a sharp tongue but still he's a nice ┏person [guy].
・彼の口の悪さは有名だ.　The sharpness of his tongue is well known.
口にする　⇒くちにする.

►口に出さない　keep 《a matter》 to oneself; hold one's tongue
・口には出さなかったが, 目で非難していた.　She didn't put it into words, but she was criticizing me with her eyes.
・彼は口には出さないが彼女にほれている.　He doesn't ┏express [give voice to] it, but he's in love with her.
・思っていることを口に出す　give voice to one's thoughts; express one's thoughts in words; be vocal about what one thinks
・はっきり口に出して認めたわけではない.　He didn't admit it in so many words.

口に上る　be a topic of conversation; be talked about.
►そのうわさは皆の口にのぼっていた.　The rumor was on everybody's lips.

►口を緘して語らない　keep one's lips sealed and be silent.
口を利く　1 〔ものを言う・話す〕 speak 《to [with]…》; talk 《to [with]…》; pass a remark; make a comment.
►乱暴な口をきく　speak ┏violently [abusively, roughly]; use abusive language; be rough-spoken
・彼は何でも知っているような口をきく.　He talks as ┏if [though] he knew everything. ｜ The way he talks you'd think he knew everything.
・口がきける　can ┏talk [speak]; be able to ┏talk [speak]
・口がきけるのは人間だけである.　Man alone has the power of speech.
・口がきけなくなる　〔永久に〕 be deprived of one's power of speech; lose one's ┏speech [tongue]; 〔一時的に〕 cannot speak 《for weeping》; find oneself unable to speak 《for terror》; be tongue-tied

・あいつは口のきき方を知らない.　That bastard doesn't know how to talk.
・その知らせには口もきけないほどびっくりした.　I was so surprised at the news (that) I was speechless.
2 〔仲を執(と)り持つ〕 (仲裁する) mediate 《between…》; (あっせんする) offer one's good offices 《on behalf of…》; (仲人をする) act as (a) go-between; 〔有力者が〕 use one's influence 《for…》; 〔口添えをする〕 recommend; put in a (good) word 《for [on behalf of]…》; speak up 《for sb》.
►あの連中には私が口をきいてあげよう.　I'll be your spokesperson to them.
・彼が就職できたのは私が口をきいてやったからだ.　The reason he could get a job is that I put in a good word for him.
口を切る　1 〔最初に発言する〕 be the first to speak; open the ┏conversation [discussion]; break the silence; break the ice 《in regard to…》; (言いづらいことを) broach 《a matter》.
2 〔封を切る〕 uncork 《a bottle of wine》; tap 《a barrel of beer》; open 《a bottle of orange juice》.
口を極めて　loudly; lavishly; 《praise》 to the skies; scathingly 《deride》.
►口をきわめてほめる　be ┏loud [warm, lavish] in sb's praise; speak in the highest praise of…; praise [laud] sb to the skies
・口をきわめてののしる　rain down curses on sb's head; call sb every name in the book.

口を出す　interrupt; intrude; put ┏a word [ᐦone's oar] in; cut [butt, barge, 《口》 horn] in; 〔干渉する〕 intervene; interfere in…; meddle ┏in [with]…; 〔横から口を入れる〕 offer unsolicited ┏opinions [advice]; 《口》 *chime in [ᐦchip in 《with…》]
・他国の内政問題には口を出すべきではない.　One country should not interfere in the internal affairs of another. [⇒くちだし]

・お前が口を出すから話がややこしくなるんだ.　Your butting into the conversation makes things difficult.
・余計なところに口を出すな.　Don't butt in on what doesn't concern you. ｜ Don't stick your nose in where you're not wanted. ｜ Who asked you to butt in? ｜ Mind your own business.

口を突いて出る　pour [rush, flow] from one's lips; spring to one's lips.
►思わず賞賛の言葉が口を突いて出てきた.　Words of praise spontaneously ┏sprang to [poured from] my lips.
口をつける　put to one's lips; eat; drink; taste.

・口をつけないでおく　leave ┏uneaten [undrunk, untasted].
口をつぐむ　stop [cease] speaking; fall [be] silent; hold one's tongue; 《口》 clam up.
►話半ばで口をつぐむ　stop speaking midway through 《a sentence, a speech, a line》; cut oneself short
・話そうとしていったん開いた口をまたつぐんだ.　He opened his mouth to speak and then ┏shut it [《口》 clammed up] again.
・彼女はそれっきり口をつぐんでしまった.　That shut her up like a clam.
口を慎む　be careful of one's ┏speech [language]; control [watch, guard] one's tongue; watch what one says; keep a civil tongue in one's head.
口をとがらす　1 〔おちょぼ口にする〕 pout one's lips.

►二人は口をとがらして抗議した.　Frowning, the two of them protested.
口を閉ざす　shut [close] one's mouth; 《口》 clam up.
►口を固く閉ざして語らない　clamp one's mouth shut and not speak.
口を濁す　speak ┏unclearly [obscurely]; make a nebulous statement.
口をぬぐう　wipe one's mouth clean (after sneaking a bite of food); 〔知らないふりをする〕 feign [pretend] innocence; act innocent.
►口をぬぐって知らん顔をする　feign [pretend] innocence and ignorance.
口を糊(のり)する　eke out a living.

►彼女の口をふさいでおけよ.　Muzzle her! ｜ Somebody put a muzzle on her.
口を割る　tell; speak out; come out with 《some information, one's idea》; confess; disclose [reveal, betray] 《a secret》; 《口》 spill the beans; 《俗》 squeal; *sing.
►口を割らせる　draw sb out; get information out of sb; get sb to ┏confess [《口》 spill the beans, 《俗》 squeal, *sing].

人の口に戸は立てられない　You can't shut the doors of people's mouths. ｜ There's no stopping gossip. ｜ Tongues will wag. ｜ ᐦThere's no silencing Mrs. Grundy.

◧口約束　⇒くちやくそく.

►釘が利いている[いない].　The nail is ┏fast [loose].
・釘がよく利かない.　The nail doesn't hold well.
►(箱のふたなどを)釘で打ちつける　nail down
・表札を釘で打ちつける　nail a nameplate 《on [to] the door》.
►帽子を釘にかける　put [hang] a hat on a ┏nail [peg]
・釘による傷　a nail ┏wound [puncture]
・ドレスを釘に引っかけた.　She caught her dress on a nail. ｜ A nail caught her dress. ｜ Her dress got caught on a nail.
►釘の頭　a nailhead; the head of a nail
・釘の先を曲げる　〔抜けないように〕 clinch a nail.
►釘を打つ　nail; hit a nail; drive (in) a nail
・釘を打ち込む　drive [knock] in a nail; hammer a nail 《into some wood》
・釘を頭まで打ち込む　drive a nail home
・釘を抜く　extract [pull out, draw out] a nail; unnail 《a box》
・足に釘を刺す[通す]　run a nail ┏into [through] one's foot.
釘を刺す　〔念を押す〕 remind sb of sth; jog sb's memory; 〔警告する〕 give sb a warning; lay down the law.
►一本釘を刺す　make it clear 《that…》; drive home a point
・彼とつきあうのはかまわないが結婚はだめだと父は釘を刺した.　Her father (sternly) reminded her that he didn't mind her meeting the young man, but she was not to marry him.
・これ以上遅刻すると減給するぞと彼に釘を刺しておいた.　I made it clear to him that his pay would be cut if he was late again.
◨合わせ釘　〔接合用〕 a dowel.
飾り釘　an ornamental stud.
鉄丸釘　a wire nail.
銅[しんちゅう]釘　a ┏copper [brass] nail.
◧釘打ち機　a ┏riveting [nailing] machine; a nailer; a riveter.
釘隠し　an ornament to cover a nailhead; a decorative nailhead cover.
釘裂き　a rip caused by a nail.
釘師　a pachinko nail master (whose adjustment of the nails on the face of the machine once regulated profit and loss).
釘製造所　a nail factory; a nailery.
釘樽　a nail keg.
釘抜き　(a pair of) ┏pincers [nippers]; carpenter's ┏pincers [nippers]; a nail ┏puller [extractor]; 〔釘抜き金づち〕 a claw hammer.

くぎり【句切り・区切り】 [ローマ字](kugiri)
1 〔文や句の切れ目〕 a pause; a juncture; (句読点) a punctuation mark; punctuation.
►(文に)区切りをつける　〔句読点をつける〕 punctuate.
2 〔物事の切れ目〕 a break; a place to leave off; 〔間〕 a pause; a period; 〔終わり〕 an end; a stop.
►ちょうど区切りがいいから今日はここまでにして明日に回そう.　This seems to be a good place to leave off until tomorrow. ｜ Let's finish at this convenient point and begin again tomorrow.
・やっとこの問題にも一区切りがついた.　We have finally closed a chapter in this matter.
►仕事に一区切りをつける　find a good place to stop working.
◧区切り符号　＝くとうてん.

くぎり【句切り・区切り】 [ローマ字](kugiri)
1 〔文や句の切れ目〕 a pause; a juncture; (句読点) a punctuation mark; punctuation.

くぎる【句切る・区切る】 [ローマ字](kugiru)
1 〔文などをまとまりで切る〕 punctuate; mark [set] off 《a clause》 with a comma.
►話を区切る　punctuate a story
・文を 4 つに区切る　punctuate a sentence into four parts
・一句ずつ句切って読む　read 《a text》 with pauses between phrases
・文を短く句切って書く　write in short sentences.
►彼は一言(ひとこと)一言ゆっくりと句切って話した.　He spaced his words carefully and slowly. ｜ He spoke slowly, ┏pausing [with pauses] between his words.
2 〔仕切る・わける〕 cut off [divide] 《by a partition》; mark off; partition (off).
►時間を区切る　divide up the time
・時代をいくつかに区切る　mark off a period into several divisions
・範囲を区切って出題する　divide 《a text》 into sections to be tested separately
・土地を区切る　mark [parcel] out some land.

くぎづけ【釘付け】 [ローマ字](kugizuke)
1 〔釘を打ちつけること〕 nailing.
►釘付けにする　nail (up) 《a box》; nail down 《a lid》; fasten sth with nails
・厳重に釘付けにする　nail sth tight
・ふたを箱に釘付けにする　nail a cover on a box.
►釘付けの箱　a nailed box.
2 〔値段などの変動のないこと〕 (price) pegging.
►値段を…円に釘付けする　peg a price at…yen
・最高を…円に釘付けする　fix a price ceiling at…yen.
►物価は 4 月の水準に釘付けになっている.　The price is pegged on the April basis.
►相場は釘付け状態である.　The market is stationary.
3 〔動きのとれない状態〕 being stationary; immobility; a standstill.
►(飛行機などを)地上に釘付けにする　ground 《an airplane》
・その場に釘付けにされる　stand ┏transfixed [riveted] on the spot; be brought to a standstill
・艦隊は地中海に釘付けになっている.　The fleet is ┏bottled [tied] up in the Mediterranean (Sea).
・驚きのあまりその場に釘付けになった.　Surprise nailed him to the spot.
・足が床に釘付けになったかのように身動きがとれなかった.　As if stuck to the floor, I could not move. ｜ It was as if I had been cemented to the floor.
・全員の視線がテレビ画面に釘付けになった.　Everyone's eyes became riveted on the TV screen.
►彼はテレビに釘付けだった.　He was glued to the TV.
◧釘付け賃金　a pegged wage.

・それくらいなら喜んで用立てよう.　If that is all you want, I'll be glad to lend you that much.

・あの子はもう大人といってもいいくらいだ.　He's as good as all grown up.
・倍でも安いくらいだ.　It would be cheap at twice the sum.
・実にすばらしい景色で君に見せたいくらいだった.　It was such a stunning view, I wish I could have shown it to you.
・金を貸すどころかこっちで借りたいくらいだ.　Me lend him money? Hell, I could use a loan myself!
・彼は神童といってもいいくらい聡明な子供だった.　He was so ┏wise [intelligent] he was called a child prodigy.
・あんなマンションをポンと即金で買うくらいだから相当お金持ちなんだろう.　You know they're loaded if they can plunk down cash for a condo like that.
3 〔程度が最も高いものを示す〕
►あのくらい似た兄弟も少ない.　Even for brothers, their resemblance is uncanny.
・日本人で彼女くらい情熱的なフラメンコを踊る人も少ない.　There are very few Japanese who dance the flamenco with the fire she does.

4 〔望ましくない極端な例を示す〕
►降参するくらいなら死んだほうがましだ.　I would ┏sooner [rather] die than give in.
・1 時間も電車を待つくらいなら歩こう.　If it's an hour's wait for the train, we might as well walk.
・それに 5 万円も出すくらいならこっちを買ったほうがいい.　If it costs fifty thousand yen for that one, we're better off buying this.
・負けて泣くくらいならどうしてもっと練習しなかったんだ.　If you hate losing so much that you cry, why didn't you practice harder?
5 〔最低限のことを表す〕 at least.
►それくらいのことは知ってるよ.　I know that much.
・それくらいのことで怒るな.　Don't get upset at such trifles.
・そんなことをやるのは君くらいのものだ.　No one but you would do such a thing.

►お茶の一杯くらい出してくれてもよさそうなものだ.　They might at least give us a cup of tea.

・私にできるのは話を聞いてやることくらいだ.　About all I can do is listen to what he has to say.

1 〔悩み苦しむこと〕 trouble(s); difficulties; hardship(s); suffering(s).
〜する undergo [suffer, (have to) go through] hardships; be in ┏trouble [distress]; have a hard time (of it); have rough sledding.
►…するのに苦労する　have trouble doing; have a hard time doing; go through hardships to do
・あの連中にはずいぶん苦労したよ.　I have ┏suffered [had to endure] much [a lot] because of them.
・この人となら一緒に苦労してもいいと思った.　I felt I wouldn't mind having a hard life as long as it was with this person.
・彼女は幼いときに親をなくし苦労して育った.　She lost both parents when she was small and had to ┏suffer [go through] a lot as she grew up.
►苦労が絶えない　have no end of trouble
・子を持って初めて親の苦労がわかった.　I didn't appreciate how much a parent has to go through until I had my own child.
►そんなのは苦労のうちに入らない.　You can't consider that ┏hardship [suffering]!! ▶that に強勢を置く.
►苦労を共にする　share in sb's ┏hardships [distress]
・いろいろと苦労をする　taste [experience] all sorts of (hard) knocks in life; undergo [go through] all sorts of ┏hardships [troubles]; receive a good many hard knocks
・彼は世間の苦労をまるっきり知らない人だ.　He hasn't had any lessons whatsoever in the school of hard knocks.
►どんな苦労もいとわずに　enduring every hardship; through thick and thin
・なんの苦労もなく暮らす　pass one's life without experiencing the least hardship
・この苦労もやがて終わるさ.　These troubles will soon be over.
►若いときの苦労は買ってでもしろ.　Be willing to endure hardship while you're young.
2 〔骨折り〕 toil; labor; pains; trouble.
〜する work hard; labor; toil; take pains; make strenuous efforts; go through the mill.
►苦労してかせいだ金　hard-earned money
・苦労して手に入れた本　a book that was hard to come by
・このコツがわかるようになるにはもう 2, 3 年苦労しなきゃ.　It will take you a couple more years of ┏strenuous effort [hard work] to get the hang of it.
・彼女は苦労してその方法を編み出した.　It took her a lot of hard work to ┏devise [think up] that method.
►君などはまだ苦労が足りない.　You still need to put in more hard effort (to enrich your experience).
►苦労のかいがあった.　It was worth the ┏hard work [labor, strenuous effort, trouble].
・長年の苦労が水の泡だ.　Long years of ┏toil [pain, hard work, trouble] are all [have all been] for nothing.
・こうした苦労の末, ようやくその技術を身につけたのです.　It was at the end of hard effort like this that I finally learned that technique.
►苦労をかける　put sb to trouble; give [cause] sb trouble
・私のミスで同僚に苦労をかけてしまった.　Because of my mistake I caused my colleagues trouble.
►この仕事を成功させるのは並大抵の苦労じゃなかっただろう.　Making a success of this job must have required more than ordinary hard work.
・ご苦労かけてすみません.　I am sorry to have put you to so much trouble.
・やあ, ご苦労さま.　〔出張に出かける人に〕 Goodby(e) and Godspeed! ｜ 〔仕事をしている人に〕 Good, keep up the fine work! ｜ 〔仕事を終わった人に〕 Well done [Well done, everybody]! (It was a fine day's work.) ｜ 〔出張の任務を終えて帰ってきた人に〕 Well done!
・ご苦労な話だね.　Sounds like more trouble than it's worth.
・この暑さの中をゴルフとは何ともご苦労なことだ.　It must be quite a struggle to play golf in heat like this.
3 〔心配〕 care(s); anxiety; worry; concern.
〜する worry (oneself) 《about…》; be ┏worried [anxious, concerned] 《about…》.
►息子にはさんざん苦労させられた.　Our son caused us plenty of ┏worries [gray hairs].
・金で苦労する　have financial worries; be ┏distressed [anxious, worried] by a lack of money; be ┏pinched [hard up] for money.
►浮き世の苦労　the cares of this mortal life; worldly cares.
►苦労が多い　be full of ┏cares [troubles]
・君も苦労が絶えないね.　You have no end of worries, eh?
・年を取ると苦労が増える.　Cares multiply as one gets older.
►苦労の種　a ┏cause [source] of ┏trouble [anxiety, worry, concern, distress]
・それが苦労の種だ.　That's what's the ┏source [cause] of so much ┏trouble [anxiety, worry, concern].
・苦労のない　free from ┏care [worry]; carefree.
►苦労をかける　cause 《others》 anxiety; worry sb
・浮き世の苦労を忘れる　forget [lay aside] all the cares of this life
・彼は絶えず親に苦労をかけている.　He is a constant source of anxiety to his parents.
►金持ち苦労多し.　Much coin, much care. 【諺】
◧苦労話　a story of one's ┏toil [labor, pains].

くさい【臭い】 [ローマ字](kusai)
1 〔いやなにおいがする〕 ill-[foul-]smelling; stinking; malodorous; offensive; fetid; 《口》 smelly; stinky; 〔…臭い〕 smelling of 《fish》; reeking of 《garlic》. [⇒-くさい]
►臭いにおい　a bad [a foul, an offensive] smell
・臭いにおいがする　smell (bad); make [give out] a bad smell; stink
・臭い息　foul [strong] breath; mouth odor.
►おまえ足が臭いよ.　Your feet stink! ｜ You've got smelly feet!
2 〔怪しい〕 suspicious; fishy.
►あの男は臭い.　There is something ┏suspicious [fishy] about him. ｜ He looks very suspicious.
・〔犯罪の疑いをかけて〕 どうもあいつが臭いと思った.　He was the one I suspected. ｜ He looked really suspicious to me.
・〔悪事などをかぎつけて〕 臭いぞ.　There's something fishy in the air. ｜ I smell a rat.
3 〔演技などが下手でわざとらしい〕 unskilled; clumsy; hammy.
►〔演技を見ながら〕 臭い演技だなあ.　It's a pretty clumsy performance.
臭い飯を食う　〔刑務所に入る〕 serve a prison term; do [serve] time 《at…》.
臭い物にふたをする　⇒くさいもの.
臭くなる　start to ┏smell [stink].

-くさい【-臭い】 [ローマ字](-kusai)
1 〔…のにおいがする〕 smell [stink, reek, smack] of….
►にんにく臭い　smell [stink, reek] of garlic
・酒臭い　smell [reek] of liquor.
►ガス臭いぞ.　I (can) smell gas. ｜ There's a smell of gas.
・彼はとても[少し]たばこ臭かった.　He smelled ┏strongly [slightly] of tobacco.
2 〔…のような感じがする〕 seem [appear] to be…; feel [look, sound] like…; smack of….
►いんちき臭い　look [sound] false
・どうもこれは間違いくさい　This looks like a mistake. ｜ This doesn't look right.
・素人臭い　⇒しろうとくさい.
►そんな貧乏臭いことはやめろ.　Stop acting so poverty-stricken. ｜ Don't be so stingy.
・〔野球で〕 ボール臭い球をストライクにとられた.　It looked like a ball, but was given as a strike.
3 〔意を強めて〕 pretty; quite; very.
►馬鹿くさい　＝ばからしい.
►けちくさいこと言うなよ.　Don't be so mean. ｜ What a mean thing to say!

くさる【腐る】 [ローマ字](kusaru)
1 〔傷んで臭くなる〕 rot; go ┏bad [rotten, off]; decay; decompose; spoil; be spoiled; be corrupted; waste away; (卵が) addle; (牛乳などが) turn sour; (肉などが) putrefy; (パンが) become stale; (水が) become foul; 〔体の一部が壊死する〕 become gangrenous; 【医】 necrose; necrotize; 〔腐食する〕 corrode; 〔ぼろぼろに朽ちる〕 crumble.

・腐った肉　meat that has gone off; rotten [decaying, decayed; putrefying, putrefied] meat
・腐りかけた肉　tainted meat; meat that's a bit high; meat that has started to go bad
・腐った魚　rotten fish
・腐った卵　a bad [an addled] egg
・腐った牛乳　sour milk
・腐ったバター　rancid butter
・腐った木　rotten [decayed] wood
・腐った水　foul water
・腐りやすい　spoil [go off] quickly; not keep well; be perishable
・腐りにくい　be long-lasting; be resistant to decay
・腐らない　keep [last] well
・根太の腐った部分を取り除く　remove the part of the joist that is rotten.
►牛乳が腐っている.　The milk has gone ┏sour [off].
・この卵は腐っている.　This egg is bad.
・腐りかけた魚を食べておなかをこわした.　I got sick from eating tainted fish.
・肉は腐る直前がおいしい.　Meat is good ┏just before it goes off [when it is high].
・酒は腐らないから置いておいても大丈夫だ.　Alcohol doesn't go off, so it's safe to leave it.
・花瓶の水が腐った.　The water in the vase has gone foul.
・爪が真っ黒に腐ってしまった.　My nail turned black (and came off).
・血行不良で指が腐った.　Bad circulation caused my fingers to become gangrenous.
・この小屋は腐って倒れかけている.　This hut is tumbling down from rot.
・彼は腐るほど金を持っている.　He has ┏more than enough money [(far) more money than he can (possibly) spend, money to burn]. ｜ He is ┏rolling in money [stinking rich].
・歴史の本なら腐るほど持ってるぞ.　When it comes to history books, I've got ┏more than you could count [any number of them].
・男なんて腐るほどいるわ. めそめそしないで.　There are ┏millions more men [men galore, plenty more fish in the sea]. So don't be upset.
・膨大な資料があいつのロッカーで腐っている.　There's a mountain of materials wasting away in his locker.
・腐っても鯛.　Sea bream is the best, even if it is going off. ｜ Quality is quality, ┏no matter how old it is [in any circumstances]. ｜ Quality (is what) counts (most).
2 〔やる気をなくす〕 feel depressed; be ┏disheartened [downhearted]; feel ┏low [down, gloomy, depressed, wretched, blue]; be [become] weary 《of…》; be ┏sick at heart [down in the dumps, out of sorts].
►彼女はどんな災難にも腐らなかった.　Whatever befell her she was not downhearted.
・何で腐ってるんだ.　What's ┏up (with you) [the matter, the problem, troubling you]?
・そんなに腐るな.　Don't let things get you down (like that)! ｜ 〔元気を出せ〕 Cheer up! ｜ It isn't the end of the world!
・こう雨ばかりじゃ腐るね.　All this rain gets you down, doesn't it? ｜ Terrible [Awful] weather, isn't it?
3 〔堕落する〕 degenerate; be corrupted; become depraved.
►性根の腐った　corrupt; depraved; rotten to the core.
►彼は根性が腐っている.　He is ┏immoral by nature [rotten to the core].
・いまの政治は腐りきっている.　Politics nowadays is riddled with corruption.

・それはわが国の安全にとって重大な脅威となるであろう.　It will ┏constitute [pose, become] a grave menace to the safety of our nation. ｜ It will seriously threaten the security of this country.

・その本には非常に興味がある.　That book interests me very much. ｜ I am very interested in (finding out more about) that book. ｜ That book is really ┏fascinating [intriguing].
・そんな生活は私には興味がない.　Such a life does not ┏attract [interest] me. ｜ I wouldn't care for a life like that.
・大臣のいすに私はまったく興味がない.　I have no interest in a ministerial post.
・その映画には大いに興味があった.　The movie looked really ┏interesting [fascinating, intriguing]. ｜ I felt really curious about the movie.
・興味がわく　have one's ┏interest [curiosity] aroused; be fascinated; be intrigued
・彼女はだんだん音楽に興味が出てきた.　She became increasingly ┏interested in [curious about] music.
・興味が深まる　gain a deeper interest
・興味が薄れる　lose interest
・考古学はいくらやっても興味が尽きない.　My interest never wanes in archaeology.
►その問題は興味に乏しい.　That subject is of little interest. ｜ There is little (that is) interesting about that subject.
►興味のある　interesting; attractive; amusing; exciting; fascinating; intriguing; of interest
・多少興味のある話　a subject of some interest; a reasonably attractive [an intriguing] topic
・興味のありそうな顔で　with a curious look; with a look of ┏curiosity [interest]; with a look that implies interest
・〔展示会で〕 興味のある人はぜひ見に来てください.　All (those) interested, please come.
・興味のない　uninteresting; of no interest; lacking interest; unattractive.
►興味を持つ[抱く]　be interested 《in…》; have [take] (an) interest 《in…》; 《口》 be (very) into…
・文学に非常な興味を持つ　have a ┏great [warm] interest in literature
・いろいろなことに興味を持っている人　a person ┏of [with] many interests
・興味を持って　with interest; with curiosity; with zest
・彼は次に何をするだろうかと, 世界中の人が興味を持って見守っている.　The whole world is watching with interest to see what he does next.
・興味を覚える　gain [pick up] (an) interest 《in…》; find pleasure 《in…》
・興味を起こさせる[かきたてる]　interest; fascinate; intrigue; arouse [rouse, awake, awaken, evoke, excite, stimulate, stir up] sb's interest 《in sth》; appeal to 《sb, sb's curiosity》
・はなはだ興味をそそるニュース　a most intriguing piece of news
・興味を引く　command interest
・興味を示す　show interest
・非常に興味を持って眺める　watch with great curiosity
・興味をそぐ　spoil sb's ┏interest [enjoyment, pleasure, fun]; kill sb's joy
・興味を失う　〈人が主語〉 lose (an) interest 《in…》; 〈物事が主語〉 lose 《its》 appeal
・この種のスポーツには若い人たちは興味を失っている.　This kind of sport has lost its appeal to young people.
・彼が異性にまったく興味を抱かないということは有名だった.　He was noted for his complete lack of interest in the opposite sex.
・私はどうしてもそのゲームに以前のような興味を感じられなかった.　I just could not work up the interest I used to have in the game.
►政治には何の興味もない.　I have no interest in politics. ｜ Politics has no interest for me.
・彼女はその鳥を興味なさそうに眺めていた.　She watched the bird with apparently little curiosity.
・それに対する私の興味は薄らいでいる.　My interest in it is ┏flagging [waning, dwindling].
・そのころには私の興味は別の問題に移ってしまっていた.　By that time my interest had ┏turned [switched] to a different subject.

soak through…; pierce through…; penetrate (through)…; transude; permeate; infiltrate into….
►雨水がしみ通った壁　a wall the rainwater has come through.
►雨が上着の下のシャツにまでしみ通った.　The rain had ┏seeped [soaked, penetrated] into the shirt beneath the coat.
・このおでんはだしが具によくしみ通っている.　The broth has thoroughly permeated the ingredients in this oden.

しみでる【滲み出る】 [ローマ字](shimideru)
ooze (out); come ┏out [through]; exude; percolate; filter ┏out [through, into…]; soak through….
►包帯に血がしみ出ていた.　The bandage was saturated with blood.
・傷口から血がしみ出ていた.　Blood was oozing from the wound.

しみだす【滲み出す】 [ローマ字](shimidasu)
ooze ┏out [through].
►傷口から血が包帯にしみ出してきた.　Blood oozed (out) from the wound through the bandage. ｜ A trickle of blood appeared from the cut through the bandage.
・上着の背中にまで汗がしみ出していた.　Sweat seeped into the back of the jacket.

しみる２【滲みる・沁みる・染みる・浸みる】 [ローマ字](shimiru)
1 【滲みる・浸みる】 〔液体などが物の内部に入り込む〕 go ┏right inside [deep into…]; soak [sink] into…; permeate; infiltrate; penetrate; pierce.
►味がよくしみた大根　a (daikon) radish that had absorbed lots of flavor
・汗のしみたシャツ　a sweat-soaked shirt; a shirt soaked with sweat.
►インクが次のページにまでしみた.　The ink went through to the next page.
・ウナギのたれがしみたご飯がおいしい.　Rice permeated with unagi sauce is delicious.
・肉に香辛料が十分にしみるには時間がかかる.　It takes time for the spices to thoroughly permeate the meat.
2 【沁みる】 〔刺激されて痛い〕 be sensitive 《to disinfectant》; be painful (when touched); give sb a twinge; react painfully 《to a stimulus》; 〔ひりひりする〕 smart; sting.
►冷たい水が歯にしみる.　My tooth hurts [I get a twinge in my tooth] when I drink cold water.
・消毒薬が傷口にしみる.　The disinfectant makes the cut ┏sting [smart].
・身にしみる　〔寒気などが〕 bite; be biting; cut sb to the bone; pierce; penetrate
・身にしみる風　a ┏piercing [biting] wind
・目にしみるような青さ　a blazing blue; a blue that hurts the eyes
・しみない目薬　eyedrops that don't ┏hurt [sting]; a painless eye lotion.
►この目薬はしみるね. うっ, しみる!　These eyedrops (make your eyes) smart. Ouch! They really do.
・煙が目にしみて痛かった.　My eyes smarted from the smoke.
・寒さが身にしみた.　I was chilled to the bone. ｜ The cold ┏was penetrating [went right through me].
・世間の冷たさが身にしみる.　I feel the coldness of the world bitterly.
3 【沁みる】 〔心にしみじみ感じる〕 feel ┏deeply [keenly, deep down]; go home; come home 《to one》; make a deep impression 《on one》.
►身にしみる　〔感銘する〕 sink deep(ly) into one's mind; go straight to one's heart; come home 《to one》; make a deep impression 《on one》; 〈人を主語に〉 feel ┏deeply [keenly, deep down]; really feel; fully [really, acutely] realize; be deeply impressed 《with…》 [⇒み２ 1]
・骨身にしみる　⇒ほねみ
・心にしみる　⇒こころ 3
・身にしみて　keenly; fully; deeply; deep down
・彼の親切が身にしみてうれしかった.　His kindness touched me deeply. ｜ I deeply appreciated his kindness.
4 【染みる】 〔影響される・染まる〕 be influenced 《by…》; catch; be ┏imbued [infected, touched] 《with…》.
►悪風にしみる　get into evil habits.

ま１【真】 [ローマ字](ma)
►真に受ける　take sth as the truth; accept 《a remark》 (as ┏true [the truth]); believe 《a statement》 (to be true); 《口》 buy
・冗談を真に受ける　take ┏seriously [as true] what was said in jest
・話を真に受ける　accept a story (at face value)
・私は彼の言うことをすっかり真に受けてしまった.　I took as the truth everything he said.
・広告の文句を真に受けるなんて君もおめでたいね.　Accepting as true the words in an advertisement-my, you're gullible, you know that?

ま２【間】 [ローマ字](ma)
1 〔時間〕 time; a while; 〔時間の空き〕 an interval; the meantime; a pause; 【音楽】 (a) rest; 〔拍子〕 timing.
►あっと言う間　⇒あっと.
►間もなく　⇒まもなく.
►発車までまだ間がある[あまり間がない].　It will be some time [It will not be long] before the train leaves.
・次の船の出るまでにはまだだいぶ間がある.　We have plenty of time [It will be a long time] before the next boat departs.
・約束の時間まで少し間があったので喫茶店に入った.　I still had a little time before the appointed hour, so I went into a coffee shop.
・上京してからまだ間がない.　I have not been long in Tokyo. ｜ I arrived in Tokyo only ┏recently [a few days ago].
・今日はもうゆっくりしている間がない.　I'm afraid I can't stay any longer today.
・間が持てない　do not know how to ┏fill in a period of 《free》 time [kill time, while away the time]
・何か読む物がないと電車の中で間が持てない.　Without something to read I don't know what to do to while away the time on the train.
・このごろでは夫と 2 人きりだと話すこともなくて間が持てない.　Lately time hangs heavy on my hands when I'm alone with my husband because we have nothing to talk about.
・間がいい　be ┏timely [well-timed]; be lucky; be fortunate
・買い換えようと思っていたプリンターが懸賞で当たった. なんて間がいいんだ.　I was thinking of buying a certain new printer, and then I won one in a contest. That was really ┏timely [lucky]!
・今日はなんて間がいいんだろう[悪いんだろう].　The luck is certainly ┏with [against] me today. ｜ This is my ┏lucky [unlucky] day, to be sure.
・間がよければ　if I am lucky enough; if things go well; if ┏circumstances are [the timing is] right; if a favorable opportunity presents itself
・散歩コースの途中にパン屋があり, 間がよければ焼きたてが手に入る.　There's a bakery along the course I take for my regular walk, and if I'm lucky I can get some bread hot from the oven.
・間が悪い　〔不都合だ〕 be awkward; be inconvenient; be the wrong time; be unlucky; 〔きまり悪い〕 feel ┏awkward [ill at ease]; be embarrassed; be self-conscious
・ちょっと今は間が悪いんだ. 後でかけ直すよ.　Now's a bit inconvenient; I'll call you back later.
・私が入っていくと, 人々は間が悪そうに突然天気の話などしはじめた.　When I went in, people looked uncomfortable and suddenly began talking about the weather and the like.
・間が悪い時は何をやってもうまく行かないものだ.　When luck is against you, no matter what you do it won't succeed.
・間が合っている[合わない]　be ┏in [out of] rhythm [sync(h), time]
・間が抜ける　the timing goes wrong; sth important gets left out
・今ごろお礼に行くのは間が抜けている.　Going to thank them at this late stage is rather pointless.
・思い切ってヒゲを剃ったら妙に間が抜けてしまった.　After I finally went ahead and shaved off my beard, there was this odd feeling that something important was missing.
►絶妙の間で　with superb timing
・絶妙の間で合いの手を入れる　insert ┏gestures [words, clapping, chanted refrains] with superb timing
・絶妙の間で料理が次々に運ばれてくる.　One dish after another is brought out with superb timing.
►留守の間に　when [while] one is out; in one's absence
・そうしている間に　in the meantime; meanwhile
・いつの間に　⇒いつのまに
・瞬く間に　⇒またたく
・知らぬ間に　⇒しる２
・彼は人が遊んでいる間に勉強した.　He studied while others were playing.
►間の悪い　〔不都合な〕 inconvenient; badly timed; unfortunate; 〔きまり悪い〕 awkward; embarrassing
・間の悪い間違い　an ┏awkward [embarrassing, unfortunate] mistake
・間の悪い冗談　an embarrassing joke
・間の悪そうな顔　an embarrassed ┏expression [look] on the face
・緊張のあまり話が続かなくて間の悪い思いをした.　I felt embarrassed when our conversation came to a standstill because of our nervousness.
・間の悪いことに　unfortunately; by ill luck; as ill luck would have it
・突然の大雨, しかも間の悪いことに車は今朝修理に出してしまった.　It's pouring outside, and unfortunately I took my car in for servicing this morning.
・間の悪い時は仕方のないものだ.　Bad luck can't be helped.
・間の抜けた　silly-looking; foolish-looking [⇒まぬけ]
・間の抜けた声　a stupid-sounding voice
・この犬はどことなく間の抜けた顔で愛嬌がある.　The indescribably ┏silly [《口》 dopey] looks this dog gives me are so ┏winning [sweet].
・試験日を間違えるなんてずいぶん間の抜けた話だ.　To mistake the date of an examination-what a very dumb thing to do!
・間ののびた　slow; halting; dull [⇒まのび]
・間の取り方　the tempo; the beat; timing
・演技は間の取り方がすべてだ.　In acting, timing is everything.
►埋め立て後間もない土地　newly reclaimed land
・ちょっとの間も　even for a ┏minute [moment]
・寝ている間も　even in sleep
・食事をする間もない　have no time even to have a meal
・着替える間もなく　unable to take time even to change (one's) clothes
・寝る間も惜しんで働く　work long hours, begrudging even time for sleep.
►間を置く　put a pause 《after [between]…》
・少し間を置いて　after a ┏short [brief] interval
・2 週間の間を置いて　after an interval of two weeks; after ┏a two-week [two weeks'] interval
・遠くで花火が揚がり, やや間を置いて音が聞こえた.　In the distance I saw a firework light the sky, and a short moment later I heard the sound.
・間を持たせる　fill in ┏the time [an interval of time]
・講師の到着が遅れ, 司会者は間を持たせるのに苦労した.　The lecturer's arrival was delayed, and the master of ceremonies had a struggle to fill in the time.
2 〔空間〕 space; room; an interval. [⇒あいだ]
►木の間　⇒このま.
►間を開ける　leave (a) space; space out
・3 メートルずつ間を置いて　at intervals of three meters.
3 〔部屋〕 a room; a chamber; 〔部屋の数〕 《5》-room 《house》.
►奥の間　a back room; 〔座敷〕 a parlor
・次の間　the ┏next [adjoining] room; 〔控え室〕 an anteroom; a waiting room
・控えの間　an anteroom; a waiting room
・板の間　a room with a wooden floor.
►6 畳 2間の小さな家　a small house with two six-mat rooms.
◨江戸[京]間　a room built according to a formula based on a space between the pillars of approximately ┏1.8 [1.97] meters.
日本[洋]間　a ┏Japanese-style [Western-style] room.

まあ [ローマ字](maa)
1 〔勧めたりなだめたりするときに言う〕 now, now; come now.
►まあおかけなさい.　Do sit down!
・まあやってごらん.　Come now, give it a try.
・今日はまあゆっくりしてってください.　Today what do you say you stay for a while (instead of rushing off)?
・まあ聞いてくれ.　What do you say you hear me out? ｜ Hold on and just ┏listen [hear me out].
・まあそう固いことを言わずに.　Come now, you don't have to be so formal.
・まあそう怒るなよ. 勘弁してやれよ.　Now, now, don't get so angry. Go easy on the guy.
・まあ落ち着けって. 水でも飲む?　Now, now, relax. Would you like some water?
2 〔断言できないとき・断言を避けるときに言う〕 well; I think; I should ┏say [think]; it would seem.
►まあ, いいか　Well, I guess it's OK.
・あっ, 塩を入れすぎたかな. まあいいか.　Oh-oh, maybe that was too much salt. Oh well, I guess it's OK.
・まあ今回はやめておこう.　Hmm, I think I'll give it a pass this time.
・彼女の実力なら 3 位入賞はまあ確実だろう.　With her ability I'd say a third-place prize should be fairly certain.
・「ずいぶんいい大学を出たんですね」「ええ, まあ」　"You went to a very good university, I see."―"Yes, I guess so."
・「奥さんとは一目惚れですか」「まあそんなとこです」　"Did you fall in love with your wife at first glance?"―"I guess you could say so."
・「すごい車を買ったもんだね」「まあね」　"Boy, that car you bought's really something!"―"It's not bad."
3 〔女性が驚いたときに言う〕 Oh!; O dear!; Dear me!; Oh, my!; Good ┏gracious [heavens]!
►まあ驚いた.　What a surprise!
・まあ大変, どうしましょ.　O dear! What'll ┏I [we] do?
・まあどうしたの.　Oh my, what's happened?
・まあ, あきれた.　Oh dear, words fail me!
・まあよかった.　Thank God!
・よくもまあそんなことが言えたものね.　How dare he say such a thing!

-まい２ [ローマ字](-mai)
1 〔推量〕
►この分なら今日は降るまい.　If this keeps up it ┏shouldn't [probably won't] rain today.
・たぶんそうではあるまい.　I don't think so. ｜ I dare say not. ｜ I think not. ｜ I doubt it.
・彼はおそらく行くまい.　I doubt he'll go. ｜ The chances are he won't go.
・内部の者の犯行ではあるまい.　The crime's probably not an insider job.
・この気持ちは本人でなければわかるまいと思う.　I think nobody can understand this feeling except the person himself.
2 〔意志〕
►…でもあるまい　there's no need for…
・いい人だとは思うけど, 私もこの年になって今さら結婚でもあるまい.　I think she's a good person, but there's no need for me to get married now at my age.
・わざわざ社長が出向くほどのことでもあるまい.　I don't think the matter is so important that the president himself has to go.
・…ではあるまいか　it seems to me
・私たちがしてきたことは無駄だったのではあるまいか.　Everything we have done was ┏useless [a waste of time], it seems to me.
・…うが…まいが　whether…or not
・君が行こうが行くまいが, 俺は行く.　Whether you go or not, I am going.
・…まいとする　decide not to do
・彼は両親を心配させまいとして何も言わなかった.　He decided not to make his parents worry, so he didn't say anything.
►その先はまあ話しますまい.　I'd rather not tell you the rest.
・彼女とは口をきくまいと決心した.　I resolved not to talk to her.
・翌朝二度と酒は飲むまいと固く誓った.　The next morning I vowed never to drink sake again.
・子供の使いじゃあるまいし, こんな返事は持って帰れません.　I have not come on a child's errand, and I cannot go back with such a response.
・うさぎじゃあるまいし, 野菜料理ばっかり食ってられるか!　I'm not a rabbit! I can't live on just vegetables!

►マイナスからのスタート[出発]　a start [starting] from a weak position.

・「王手!」「参りました」　"Check!"―"You win."
・歯車が摩擦熱で参っちゃったようだ.　It looks ┏as if [《口》 like] the gears have given way because of frictional heat.
4 〔困惑する〕 become ┏dum(b)founded [nonplus(s)ed, embarrassed]; become beaten; become ┏upset [put out]; 《口》 become [get] floored; 〔悩まされる〕 become worried 《by…》; become overcome 《with…》; 〔疲れ切る〕 become exhausted; 《口》 become ┏dead (tired) [dog-tired]; crack (up); become washed ┏out [up]; feel ┏all in [done up]. [⇒へいこう４]

・この暑さには参るね.　This heat leaves me exhausted.
・こう待たされたのでは皆参ってしまう.　This waiting is getting all of us down.
・あいつのおしゃべりには参った.　The guy's yakking has left me all in.
・今度の病気には彼もだいぶ参った様子だ.　He looks as if he's ┏in quite bad shape from [been quite knocked about by] his illness.
・こう残業続きではいくら体が丈夫でも参ってしまう.　It doesn't matter how strong I am physically; with so many straight days of overtime I'm sure to break down.
・彼女は精神的にすっかり参っている.　She's a nervous wreck.
・参ったなあ. 終電に間に合わないや.　Damn it! I'm gonna miss the last train!
・参ったなあ. 給料日までまだ 3 日もある.　Damn it! There're still three more days till payday.

・家計は夫に任せっきりです.　I leave management of the family budget completely up to my husband.
・一部の親たちは, 子供のしつけを学校に任せきりにして恥じないらしい.　Some parents don't seem to feel any shame about leaving their children's training completely to the school(s).
・後始末は任せたからね.　I'll have to ask you to close up, okay?
・留守は任せたぞ.　Okay, hold the fort!
・泳ぎなら任せてください.　When it comes to swimming, you don't have to worry about me.
2 〔物事のなすがままにしておく〕 let 《sth do》; leave 《sth to…》; yield 《(sth) to sth》.
►足に任せて歩き回る　wander wherever one's legs take one
・金に任せて　without regard to cost; regardless of expense
・若さに任せて　leaving sth to youth
・力に任せて　⇒ちからまかせに
・暇に任せて…する　do at one's leisure
・運を天に任せる　resign [abandon] oneself to one's fate; trust to ┏luck [chance]; leave 《it》 to ┏chance [Providence]
・身を任せる　submit [resign] oneself to sb's will; throw oneself ┏on [upon] sb; give oneself to sb; put oneself in sb's hands
・時の流れに身を任せる　yield to the trend of the times
・心地よい音楽に身を任せる　yield to ┏pleasant [soothing] music
・本能のおもむくところに任せる　act according to the dictates of one's instinct; let instinct guide one
・家を荒れるに任せる　let one's house slowly go to ruin.
►「彼とはうまく行ってるの?」「ご想像にお任せします」　"Are things going well with you and him?"―"I leave that to your imagination."
・思うに任せぬことばかりだ.　I can't do anything the way I want.
・静かな波に身を任せてぼーっとしていると, 天国にいる気分だ.　When I let myself float along on quiet waves and don't think about anything, I feel as if I'm in Heaven.
・酔いに任せて上司の悪口を並べ立てた.　Letting the intoxication take over, he made one complaint after another about his boss.
・勢いにまかせて敵陣深く攻め入った.　Carried on by their momentum, they penetrated deeply into the enemy camp.
・私は深く感動し, しばし涙の流れるに任せた.　Deeply moved, for a while I let the tears flow freely.
・女は長い髪を風に吹かれるに任せて立ちつくしていた.　The woman stood there, letting her long hair blow in the wind.

・幕が下りる[閉じる, 引かれる]　the curtain ┏falls [closes]; 〔芝居が終わる〕 the play ends; 〔物事が終わる〕 things draw to a close
・幕が下りても拍手は鳴りやまなかった.　Even after the curtain fell the applause didn't stop.
・社長の引責辞任で事件はあっけなく幕が引かれた.　With the president of the company taking responsibility and resigning, the incident quickly drew to a close.
►幕に[と]なる　〔芝居が終わる〕 the play ends; 〔物事が終わる〕 things come to an end
・舞台中央, 主役 2 人が寄り添ったところで幕になった.　The play ended with the two principal actors snuggled together at center stage.
・議論はかみあわぬまま, 引き続き検討するということでひとまず幕となった.　The discussion came to a temporary halt without a meeting of minds and a decision to continue studying the matter.
►幕のすき間から舞台をのぞく　peek at the stage through a part in the curtains.
►幕を開ける[上げる]　〔引いて〕 draw [pull] open the curtain; 〔上に〕 raise the curtain; 〔物事を始める〕 begin doing
・関係者一同はらはらしながら初日の幕を開けた.　Everyone concerned was apprehensive as they opened the curtain on the first day.
・いよいよ明日, 決勝トーナメントが幕を開ける.　Tomorrow we shall at last raise the curtain on the championship tournament.
・幕を閉じる[下ろす, 引く]　lower [drop, let down, close] a curtain; 〔物事を終わらせる〕 bring ┏the curtain down 《on sth》 [sth to a close]
・大会はようやく熱戦の幕を下ろした.　The tournament at last brought the curtain down on the hard-fought contests.
・さしもの老舗も不況には勝てず, 創業 200 年の歴史に幕を下ろした.　Unable to overcome the recession, even the venerable old shop brought the curtain down on two hundred years of being in business.
・彼女は自らの手で人生の幕を閉じた.　She brought life to a close with her own hands.
・…の幕を切って落とす　〔華々しく…を始める〕 begin with a ┏flourish [grandiose gesture]; begin spectacularly
・華やかなファンファーレとともに, 3 日間にわたる祭の幕が切って落とされた.　The three-day festival began in spectacular fashion with a colorful flourish of trumpets.
・ついに高速通信時代の幕が切って落とされた.　At long last the age of high-speed communications made a spectacular beginning.
・この発見が, 後に続く宇宙開発競争の幕を切って落とすことになった.　This discovery spectacularly opened the curtain on the space development race that followed after.
►歌舞伎座で忠臣蔵をひと幕のぞいてきた.　I've been to the Kabuki Theater to see one act of The Chūshingura.
・そろそろ幕だな.　Pretty soon it's curtains, I guess.
2 〔場面〕 a ┏role [part] (to play).
►…の出る幕ではない　〔…は関知すべきでない〕 have nothing to do with sth
・君なんかの出る幕じゃない.　That's ┏no business of yours [none of your business, nothing to do with you, not your department]. ｜ Mind your own business. ｜ You keep out of this.
・ここは親の出る幕ではない. 子供たちに任せよう.　This is something we should keep out of. Let's let the kids take care of it.
・…の出る幕はない　〔…は必要とされていない〕 have no need for 《sb, sth》
・この作業には機械の出る幕はない.　In these operations there's no ┏place [role] for a machine.
・昼時の調理場は戦場のようで, 手伝おうにも素人の出る幕はなかった.　The kitchen at noontime is like a battlefield, and it's no place for somebody without experience who wants to lend a hand.
►出る幕がない　have no role to play.
►ここからはカウンセラーの出る幕だ.　From this point on there's a place for a counselor.
3 〔(仕切・装飾のための)大きな布〕 a curtain.
►水の幕　a sheet of water.
►幕で花見の席を囲う　string a curtain around a spot where one's group is viewing cherry blossoms.
►幕を張る　stretch a curtain
・(場所に)紅白の幕を張りめぐらす　erect a curtain of red and white vertical stripes around a site
・幕を巻き上げる　roll up a curtain
・幕を引きしぼる　pull [draw] aside a curtain.
4 〔相撲の〕 the senior grade. [⇒まくうち, まくした, まくじり]
►幕に上がる　rise [be promoted] to the lowest rank in the senior grade
・幕に残る　remain the lowest-ranking wrestler in the senior grade.
◨横断幕　a banner strung across 《a road》.
終幕　the final act.
序幕　the ┏first [opening] act; Act 1.
通し幕　one continuous act.
中幕　the middle piece.
ひと幕見　〔歌舞伎の〕 ⇒ひとまくみ.
◧幕開け　＝まくあき.

・糸を糸巻きに巻く　wind thread ┏on [to] a reel; wind a reel with thread; reel 《thread》
・毛糸を巻いて玉にする　wind wool into a ball
・釣り糸を巻く　wind [reel] one's line in

・首にスカーフを巻く　wind a scarf around one's neck
・腰にロープを巻く　wrap a rope around one's waist
・ベーコンでアスパラガスを巻く　wind bacon around (sticks of) asparagus
・舌を巻く　⇒した２
・酔ってくだを巻く　⇒くだ
・尻尾を巻いて逃げ出す　⇒尻尾をまく (⇒しっぽ)

►長い物には巻かれろ.　If you can't beat 'em, join 'em.
・体にバスタオルを巻いて風呂場を出た.　I wrapped a towel around me and went out of the bathing room.

・会場には笑いが渦を巻いた.　Laughter went around the assembly hall.

・落ち葉が風に巻かれてくるくる舞った.　Fallen leaves, swirled by the wind, swung around in circles.

►遠巻きにする　⇒とおまき
